treatment.etymology: [Chinese yin, silver, and hing, apricot, in reference to appearance of the seed]
treatment.description: Leaf blades broader than long. Pollen cones lax, elongate. Ovules often abscising before fertilization. Seeds 1--2 per peduncle.
treatment.discussion: The genus is known from fossils that date back nearly 200 million years and are nearly identical to present-day trees.
treatment.global_distribution: widely cultivated in temperate regions worldwide.
